definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: The neo-peasant-worker is a new social stratum which comes into appearance in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 新农民工工人阶层是近年来出现的新型社会阶层。

sentences.english: Chapter Two, the basic theory of of political participation of China's new social class white-collar women.
sentences.chinese: 第二章我国新社会阶层白领女性政治参与的基本理论。

sentences.english: It is a non-linear interaction between education and social stratum structure.
sentences.chinese: 教育与社会阶层结构是一种非线性的互动关系。

sentences.english: And summarized the current analysis of Jiangcun-social class about academic results.
sentences.chinese: 并总结了目前国内关于江村社会阶层分析的学术成果。

sentences.english: The raging tide of China's revolution is forcing all social strata to decide their attitude.
sentences.chinese: 中国革命的怒潮正在迫使各社会阶层决定自己的态度。

sentences.english: There exists a close relation between social stratum and educational obtainment.
sentences.chinese: 社会阶层与教育获得之间存在着密切的联系。

sentences.english: The policy-making democratized request different social class can the order participation decision-making.
sentences.chinese: 决策的民主化要求不同社会阶层能有序参与决策。

sentences.english: There began to be considerable social stratification within this people.
sentences.chinese: 而这个民族开始形成一个重要的社会阶层。

sentences.english: New social classes of non- institutionalized political participation should not be overlooked.
sentences.chinese: 新社会阶层的非制度化政治参与也不容忽视。

sentences.english: Divisions of social class are also manifest in gates.
sentences.chinese: 社会阶层的分划，也显示于门。

sentences.english: The clan was a class with dominant position in Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 世族是中古时期据有统治地位的社会阶层。
